DOC.brief_title: Financial Health Incentives Promote Physical Activity Among Hospital Employees : A Randomized Control Trial
DOC.detailed_description: A 24-week , parallel arm , randomize control trial employ examine impact incentive physical activity among physically inactive Hamilton Health Science Corporation employee . Participants randomly allocate ( 1:1 ) control ( i.e . wellness program accelerometer ) intervention group ( i.e . wellness program , accelerometer , incentive ) , intervention participant receive reward point complete daily step count goal . After randomization , baseline 'run-in ' assessment phase occur one week prior study intervention ( T0 ) . During 'run-in ' period , participant wear Bluetooth enable StepsCount Piezo accelerometer , track participant ' daily step moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) , synchronize accelerometer ( i.e . upload information ) Change4Life program seven day . Participants also ask complete Behavioural Regulation Exercise Questionnaire ( BREQ-3 ) Self-Efficacy Exercise Scale . Throughout 24-week study , participant ask wear accelerometer synchronize Change4Life program daily . Date , step per day , bout minute MVPA per day ( bout include 10 continuous minute MVPA ) collect accelerometer synchronize . Daily synchronization accelerometer Change4Life program must complete 10 next morning . Participants instructed increase daily step count 1,000 2,000 step baseline ( T0 ) course first six week study . On week 7 , participant ask increase daily step per day 3,000 baseline , maintain level activity duration study . Outcome measure assess baseline ( T0 ) , intervention end point ( T2 ) , follow ( T3 ) .
